intro: Oxytropis dehra-duni, commonly known as the Dehra Dun oxytropis, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant is native to the Himalayan region, particularly found in the Indian states of Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, often growing at high altitudes. Oxytropis dehra-duni is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility in nutrient-poor areas.
